_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:39:20 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of cancelled operations changed?
analysis_commentary:
Figures from the latest quarter suggest that there are 18,389 elective operations cancelled per quarter from a total of nearly two million elective operations performed, which represents less than one per cent of all elective admissions.

This ratio of cancelled elective operations has decreased over the time period covered by the data. When comparing equivalent quarter 4 in 1994/95 to 2014/15 it has dropped by 0.14 per cent points, which represents a 12 per cent decrease. During this same time period the number of elective admissions have risen by 60 per cent suggesting that not only has the NHS been able to cope with the increasing demand it has been able to improve on previous performance.

When looking at the ratio instead of absolute numbers it doesn't, however, remove the seasonal variation seen with the absolute numbers.
